summary.para: Identifies an authentication service, authorization service, and the authentication information for the specified authentication service.
The authentication service. This member can be a single value from the Authentication Service Constants.
The authorization service. This member can be a single value from the Authorization Constants.
A pointer to the authentication information, whose type is specific to the authentication service identified by dwAuthnSvc.

For Schannel (RPC_C_AUTHN_GSS_SCHANNEL), this member either points to a structure that contains the client's X.509 certificate or is NULL if the client has no certificate or wishes to remain anonymous to the server.
For NTLMSSP (RPC_C_AUTHN_WINNT) and Kerberos (RPC_C_AUTHN_GSS_KERBEROS), this member points to a or structure that contains the user name and password.

For Snego (RPC_C_AUTHN_GSS_NEGOTIATE), this member is either NULL, points to a structure, or points to a structure. If it is NULL, Snego will pick a list of authentication services based on those available on the client computer. If it points to a SEC_WINNT_AUTH_IDENTITY_EX structure, the structure's PackageList member must point to a string containing a comma-separated list of authentication service names and the PackageListLength member must give the number of bytes in the PackageList string. If PackageList is NULL, all calls using Snego will fail.

For authentication services not registered with DCOM, pAuthInfo must be set to NULL and DCOM will use the process identity to represent the client. For more information, see COM and Security Packages.
